external_references.description: Symantec. (2018, July 18). The Evolution of Emotet: From Banking Trojan to Threat Distributor. Retrieved March 25, 2019.
Brumaghin, E.. (2019, January 15). Emotet re-emerges after the holidays. Retrieved March 25, 2019.
Trend Micro. (2019, January 16). Exploring Emotet's Activities . Retrieved March 25, 2019.
Özarslan, S. (2018, December 21). The Christmas Card you never wanted - A new wave of Emotet is back to wreak havoc. Retrieved March 25, 2019.
Lee, S.. (2019, April 24). Emotet Using WMI to Launch PowerShell Encoded Code. Retrieved May 24, 2019.

objects.description: [Emotet](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0367) has sent Microsoft Word documents with embedded macros that will invoke scripts to download additional payloads. (Citation: Symantec Emotet Jul 2018)(Citation: Talos Emotet Jan 2019)(Citation: Trend Micro Emotet Jan 2019)(Citation: Picus Emotet Dec 2018)(Citation: Carbon Black Emotet Apr 2019)
